snippet: Of the 445 Lower Manhattan buildings labeled contaminated or otherwise temporarily uninhabitable after the storm, scores could remain so for weeks or possibly months.
abstract: Robert D LiMandri, New York City’s buildings commissioner, says that scores of the 445 Lower Manhattan buildings his inspectors have labeled contaminated or otherwise temporarily uninhabitable because of Hurricane Sandy could remain so for weeks or possibly months; structures cited include some that house huge financial services companies and other large businesses.
lead_paragraph: Of the 445 Lower Manhattan buildings labeled contaminated or otherwise temporarily uninhabitable after the storm, scores could remain so for weeks or possibly months.

headline.seo: Many Flooded Manhattan Buildings May Stay Closed
headline.main: Many Flooded Manhattan Buildings May Stay Closed
headline.print_headline: Flooded Manhattan Buildings May Stay Closed
